decks.notes: This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced aggression with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Orcish Bowmasters. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Grief to control the opponent's hand. Additionally, the deck has removal options such as Lightning Bolt and Terminate to deal with threats on the board. The inclusion of cards like Not Dead After All and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provides recursion and card advantage, while finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger help close out games quickly. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of early creature pressure and disruptive plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands to generate large amounts of mana quickly. The goal is to ramp into Primeval Titan and use its ability to search for lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Urza's Saga to further accelerate the mana production. Overall, the key concept revolves around efficiently ramping into powerful threats and overwhelming the opponent with a quick combo finish.

This deck aims to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It uses powerful colorless spells like Karn, the Great Creator, All Is Dust, and Wurmcoil Engine to control the board and outvalue opponents. The deck also includes ramp and searching cards like Ancient Stirrings and Expedition Map to consistently find and play threats. The win condition is typically achieved by overwhelming the opponent with big creatures or by locking them out of the game with cards like Oblivion Stone and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon.

The deck focuses on creating infinite tokens with Felidar Guardian and Saheeli Rai, allowing for a powerful combo that can win the game in a single turn. Teferi, Time Raveler and Leyline Binding provide control elements to protect the combo, while cards like Solitude and Supreme Verdict offer additional removal options. The mana base is diverse to support the deck's multicolor requirements, with cards like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Wrenn and Six providing additional value and synergies. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful interactions.

The deck focuses on cycling through cards, using cards like Architects of Will and Street Wraith to quickly fill the graveyard, then casting Living End to bring all creatures back from the graveyard. The combo involves setting up the graveyard with key creatures like Glassdust Hulk and Grief, then using Living End to bring them all back at once for a powerful board presence. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Waker of Waves and Troll of Khazad-dûm to control the game while setting up the combo.

This deck utilizes a wide variety of colors to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. It focuses on using low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Wild Nacatl to deal damage quickly, while also using Tribal Flames and Leyline of the Guildpact to control the board. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional threat to the deck. With a mix of creatures, spells, and lands, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain dominance throughout the game.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and spells. It utilizes cards like Leyline of Abundance and Utopia Sprawl to accelerate mana production, while also taking advantage of Leyline of the Guildpact to reduce the cost of multicolored spells. The deck features a variety of high-impact cards such as Karn, the Great Creator, The One Ring, and Scion of Draco to apply pressure on the opponent. The goal is to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain momentum to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of ramping up mana with cards like Farseek and Explore, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Prismatic Ending and Leyline Binding. The win condition revolves around using Scapeshift to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Mountains, dealing large amounts of damage in one turn. The deck also utilizes cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Wrenn and Six to ensure consistent land drops and card advantage. The goal is to outlast the opponent and eventually overwhelm them with powerful spells.

Utilizing a combination of instant speed reanimation spells and powerful creatures with enter-the-battlefield effects, this deck aims to quickly bring back key threats like Griselbrand and Fallaji Archaeologist to gain a significant advantage over the opponent. By carefully managing resources and timing cards such as Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, the deck can consistently put pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Grief and Thoughtseize also helps to control the opponent's hand and prevent them from countering the reanimation strategy.
